channel.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
channel.description:
Replace **Bomb Swap** with: ># Jinx >Place a bomb on an additional player today, but it will be a dud if you did not select their correct class.
The user interface would be the same as for Defile. It would have infinite uses and be usable the same day as Walking Bomb.

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shrimpy:

Bomb Swap would have to be usable the same day as Walking Bomb to not be useless.

Please implement this buff instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
If you want to continue this discussion please do so here:
https://forum.imperium42.com/t/reaper-changes-by-nuke/74472
this thread is about the sorcerer so we are getting off topic

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
And again. Facelift is much MUCH stronger than any given instance of this because:

  • You can chose the class being used to fake it
  • You can chose what they publicly say before the body drops
  • There is no risk of their logs being contradicted by private information being communicated from them in whispers/jail/mystic link/other private communication
  • The ability ALSO POSSESSES SOMEONE, which has it’s own completely unrelated benefits
  • The ability gives you the logs of a player without anyone even thinking they were supposed to receive it for an extended period of time.

All of these effects are highly beneficial and non-existent in with this change.

There are of course a ton of benefits to being able to edit logs. But it’s not JUST a better facelift anymore than expert investigation is a better window peek.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shrimpy:

But it’s literally exactly like facelift except you don’t change their class. If it’s Princess on N8 you can edit their N1 to say X is killer/offensive. Which is not intended, and pretty freaking strong

nonono. There is the additional limitation of the fact that you cannot control what they say before they have been reaped. That means doing this carry’s some risk.

For one, there is the fact that under most circumstances besides maybe very early on most possible candidates for X would have already claimed and thus it wouldn’t make sense for a Princess to hide this information, thus Reaper.

If you have a gray area then you have a physician check to see if it was a reaper and bam you know it’s probably fake. Possible workaround for the reaper is to claim physician yourself and say it’s not reaper, which itself it get you Killed and if successful was also earned.

And most importantly. THIS IS INTENDED. I am specifically saying the reaper should have the ability to attempt this sort of thing with the explicit expectation that they will attempt to both frame innocents and remove information about themselves from someone’s logs.

Heck, it’s one of the key buffs in my own suggested reaper change.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
This isn’t even comparable to facelift. You have 0 control over what public information gets outed and their class will always flip correctly baring an Herbalist figuring things out ahead of time.

But it’s literally exactly like facelift except you don’t change their class. If it’s Princess on N8 you can edit their N1 to say X is killer/offensive. Which is not intended, and pretty freaking strong

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
As for UI, you would simply be able to open their logs as if they were already dead, and then edit it as if it were your own.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shrimpy:

Sadly I don’t see how this could work unless (or until?) logs are forceablly standardized. Because I want Reaper to be able to add an extra night of logs, but what would happen in practice is he would edit the entire thing or just erase them and it would be like infinite use facelift.

Deleting the entire thing is possible but ultimately just makes it obvious that they were reaped.

9/10 times it’s best to leave it in and add an extra night of logs.

This isn’t even comparable to facelift. You have 0 control over what public information gets outed and their class will always flip correctly baring an Herbalist figuring things out ahead of time.

It ultimately would usually just be best to add an extra night with additional use being either niche or high skill, both of which are acceptable for an NK.

So I’d just give him full editing access and accept all of the consequences of doing so. Possibly giving a soul cost to doing so if absolutely required.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Sadly I don’t see how this could work unless (or until?) logs are forceablly standardized. Because I want Reaper to be able to add an extra night of logs, but what would happen in practice is he would edit the entire thing or just erase them and it would be like infinite use facelift.

And if you tried to let Reaper only add logs, but not edit what’s already there, people would fill the empty space in their logs with spacefillers so reaper couldn’t edit anything

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Either way whatever the odds are they should be factored in when preforming balance. That doesn’t have to imply anything specific, just that you should keep it in mind.

Read full topic

item.title: Buffing The Sorcerer
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Well the odds of an Observer finding her with that change would go from 1/7 to 1/14 on N1 and increasing each night significantly. This is true regardless of which aspect of follow is being used. While that is a significant change in odds it’s still luck based either way without a deliberate read (which is NOT luck based either way)

Read full topic

You can chock anything up to bad luck that isn’t guaranteed reguardless of balance.

Fiddling with the odds a bit doesn’t make it any more or less random in the first place
